title: Medical-Technology Startups Post Strong Year for IPOs, Acquisitions
sub_head: Venture capitalists cash in as startups capitalize on demand spurred by the pandemic
body:
Acquisitions and initial public offerings of venture-backed medical-device companies surged in 2020 as entrepreneurs capitalized on rising interest in health-care technologies.
Venture-backed medical-device companies, a category that includes developers of devices to aid in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, monitoring or prevention of disease, posted 29 IPOs and 58 acquisition deals in 2020, according to global data from CB Insights. That is up from 21 IPOs and 49 acquisitions in 2019.
